alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 21 at 8:29PM CDT until June 21 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CEDAR...NORTHWESTERN SCOTT AND SOUTHWESTERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 829 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over New Liberty, or 8 miles northeast of Durant, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Eldridge, Walcott, Long Grove, Donahue, Dixon, Maysville, New Liberty, Camp Liberty, Bennett Park, Big Rock, Sunbury, Sherman Park and Plainview. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
